Author: rvn
Content:
You don't have to be confused about which script module to put stuff in as in theory that doesn't really matter, as long as you are mindful of hierarchy and dont try to call lower modules from the higher ones. 
Its separated this way to (internally)encourage putting stuff into the modules they belong to instead of spreading it around all over the place(good-old spaghetti code) which has a bunch of advantages, notably ability to port stuff between projects
From modding perspective you should only really need to do stuff in 3, 4 and 5, depending on the mods complexity
